runs.comm: starts off with a flat ball, room on offer as well, Guptill gets a giant stride forward forward and hammers it to the right of short cover. Even AB can't stop that.. Just sped away to the boundary
drifts in on middle, poked towards midwicket via an inside edge
sliding onto the leg stump and raps him on the pad but this was slipping down leg
Phangiso tosses it up outside off, which is driven to mid-off
Guptill leaves the use, does not meet the pitch. Off the inside edge, kisses the pad and the ball wanders to leg
looped up on middle, Williamson blunts it onto the pitch
full and zips through the channel, ignored
back of a length and slides in with the angle as Guptill camps back and blocks it to the covers
full and wider outside off, Guptill skips away outside leg, reaches out. He has a massive whoosh and does not connect
tap-and-run single in front of short cover, even as the fielder runs in and swoops down on the ball. Sharp running
pitched up and comes in a touch as Williamson attempts a drive. He mis-hits it as the ball dribbles to mid-on
length and holds its line outside off, Williamson forces a drive and finds wide mid-off
leg-stump ball. Warm-up ball. Instead of flicking it away, Guptill dribbles it off the pad towards square leg. Oh wait, there was a tickle on that..
Rabada errs too full and straight, Williamson uses his wrists and glances it to the right of a diving long-leg fielder. Beating him to his right
loads of extra bounce. 142.7ks, lifts outside off and curves away past the jittery waft
Rabada veers towards the leg stump again as Williamson picks it up and gives it marching orders over midwicket. Just sweet timing..
Williamson larrups it. Shortish and on off and middle, Williamson, having made room, smashes it over the bowler's head, beats mid-off to his right, tennis style. Flat-batted thump!
back of a length and outside off at sheesh 147.6, punched towards wide mid-off
back of a length and cuts back in off the seam as Abbott tucks up Guptill for room. Dropped onto the pitch
back of a length and on off, Guptill now steps away outside leg and scythes it up and over the covers for four
Abbott hunts for a yorker, hurls it full and straight, clipped away past midwicket. Behardien chases the ball, throws himself onto the ground slides but can't haul it in..
fractionally short and on a fourth-stump line as Guptill leans back and punches it straight to backward point
bumper, boings off the surface and beats the batsman on the hook. Excellent one-handed take from van Wyk
whoa! What a riposte from Guptill. This was a length ball on middle, not a half-volley. Guptill sizes it up and launches it over long-on
beats mid-off to his right. Top timing and equally good placement. Pitched up and on off, Williamson punchily drives it away and presents a high elbow
back of a length and on off, rolls his fingers across a cutter, which is manipulated past midwicket

another slowy ball, this is a full toss, dips in late on Guptill. He sinks to one knee and drags an attempted slog-sweep to the right of Rabada at mid-on. He could just finger-tip it away as the bowler throws his head back
good length and on off, bunted to long-on
pulls pace of this one outside off. 114.7ks. Williamson looks to run it down to third man and is beaten
banged in short, Williamson rolls his wrists on the pull. Controlled hit to deep midwicket
short, lifting ball, angled in. He manages to glove a single in front of midwicket
Williamson brings up the fifty with another wristy hit. Veering onto the pads, picked up and over backward square leg for a flattish six

Rabada breaks the opening stand. On a length and around off, Williamson aimed to launch it over the covers; he went too hard at it. Williamson ends up slices it to deep third man, where Abbott runs to his right and snaps it up
148ks and outside off, dabbed down to third man
shortish and attacking the rib-cage area, he hops up and chops it in front of cover
147ks, fired onto the pads. Latham can't put it away with a flick
drifting down leg, helped with the angle to long leg. Neat sweep..
straighter one, the line is on off, Latham drives it firmly to long-off
flighted on off, Guptill sees the flight. Guptill loves the flight. He gets a big stride forward and pummels it straight down the ground. Sends it soaring...
sliding down leg, he goes for a sweep and tickles it, nutmegging van Wyk
floated in, Latham goes down on one knee for a sweep, he top-edges it over vacant leg slip. Amla runs across from slip, but can't get there..
half-tracker down the leg side, horrid ball. Pulled away, only towards deep backward square leg
fullish and on off, patted to the off side. Miller flings to his left from short cover and makes a smart stop
Latham comes down the track and check-flicks it wide of short midwicket to long-on. Wiese bowled the change-up ball

Miller spills it, pretty full and on off, Guptill loads up and swats it away to the right of long-on. Miller moves to his right, dives and drops it. He tumbles onto the ground, creating an indentation/ mini crater on the field
fullish ball on off, dabbed in front of the covers
short and wide outside off at 114ks, Latham can't manufacture his own pace. Slapped straight to backward point
loopy on middle and leg, driven to long-on

Leie strikes and celebrates wildly. He pumps his fist and hugs AB, who asks his bowler to 'calm down'. Googly outside off, Latham steps out and shapes for a swipe. He does not connect well as he edges it thickly. Amla at first slip settles under the swirling ball
slower through the air, knocked to the leg side for one
drifting down leg, eased fine on the leg side with a sweep
flighted and outside off, forward and tapped to backward point
dragged from outside off to short fine leg with a sweep
drifts in on middle, Guptill drills it straight down the ground. It was too quick for Phangiso, as he lets it through his hands
quicker through the air, blocked back to the bowler
swept from middle and leg to short fine leg for a quick single. Elliott pushes for one
going down leg, Elliott can't sweep it away. Wide called
flighted on middle and leg, eased to the right of long-on for a couple
darted down leg, another wide
shortish and turning away, Phangiso overcorrects and is cut away to deep cover
top, top ball from Phangiso to end an wayward over. Tossed up, drifts in and turns past the outside edge. It wasn't far away from the off stump either
pushed through on middle and leg, Guptill goes low and nails a slog sweep in front of square to bring up his fifty
pitched outside leg and sliding down further, off the pad and sneaks away fine on the leg side
looped up, may have been a googly. He aims to flick to the leg side and ends up popping it over the bowler off a leading edge
fuller and on middle and leg, swept through backward square
tossed up and outside off, down the track and driven back to the bowler. He gets one hand to it and parries it away for one
leg-side wide
Leie pays for the wide. Flighted on middle, Guptill winds up and deposits it straight down the ground. Clean and effective
full and outside off, driven to deep cover
fullish and on middle, check-drives it to long-on
looks like a cutter, chipped to long-on

Behardien wheedles out the breakthrough. Believe it or not, Guptill has holed out to Miller off a full toss. Below waist height, Guptill wants to punt it away. But the bat twists in his hand as he mis-hits it. Miller runs in from long-on, dives forward and makes amends for the earlier drop. Smart take.. Miaden T20 wicket for Behardien
length and outside off, pushed firmly to the covers
prickly middle-and-off line, bunted to long-on
flatter and outside off, chopped to backward point
down the track, meets the pitch, as Elliott hoists it over the covers
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped to cow corner. Elliott wants two and gets it
sliding down leg, neat sweep to long leg
back of a length and on middle and leg as Neesham hangs back and turns it through midwicket

Phangiso roars an appeal for lbw, the forefinger goes up. Elliott's knock has been cut short. Tossed up, drifts in on middle and straightens a bit to rap Elliott on the front pad. He did not connect with the sweep after going low, and the tracker shows that the ball would have hit the top of off
full ball just a shade outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length and angled in, punched to midwicket
dragged down leg, controlled pull to long leg for one

Amla nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' end. They go to the TV umpire. Worked to short midwicket. Ronchi drifted out in search of a quick single but is sent back. He dives full-stretch and makes his ground. The bat did not pop up, and he is home
straight in line, poked in front of point
slower bouncer down leg, deflected fine of short fine leg
full and straight on off, punchy drive to long-off
Neesham gets into the act. He nips down the track, meets the pitch and tonks it over the bowler's head. That exploded off the meat of the bat. Long-on had no chance
flatter and on the pads, Neesham takes a step forward and slugs it between deep square leg and deep midwicket
low full toss, which is flicked away to deep midwicket
picked away off the pads to the right of short midwicket
length ball on off, clubbed away to wide long-on
back of a length and slanting away outside off. Neesham wants to run it down to third man. No dice
Neesham skips away outside leg, manufactures room and flays this full ball on the stumps over backward point
length ball on off, slogged away to deep midwicket
back of a length and nipping in, Ronchi manages an inside edge onto the pad and sets off
Neesham slinks away outside leg again. Rabada is wary of it as he hurls it wide outside off. The former can't reach out and slice it
140ks, quick short ball. Neesham is late onto the pull as he top-edges it. But it lands in front of long leg
slower one outside off at 113.6ks, Ronchi seeks to force it away. He ends up chopping it behind to the keeper
back of a length and outside off, another slow ball, which is dragged to long-on
slipping down leg, wide called
fullish and on off, heaved to long-on
slippery slower bouncer, slanting away outside off. Neesham shapes for a pull and only connects with thin air
full and on the stumps, drilled down to long-on

Miller pulls off an outstanding catch. Rossouw embraces him. Banged in short at Ronchi, slippery slow bouncer, climbs outside off. Ronchi flat-bats it away to deep midwicket. Miller runs in and hangs onto the fast-travelling ball. The momentum causes him to tumble onto the ground. Wiese has a wicket off his last ball.
pitched up and outside off, driven crisply past the covers, beats sweeper cover to his left. Superb strike.. Crunched
back of a length and slanting away outside off, beaten on the cut
fractionally short and tucks up Munro, fended back to the bowler
bumper, flies over a ducking Munro to keeper. Loads of height on it. Wide
picked away off the pads, beats a diving long-leg fielder
full and wide outside off, right in the hitting zone, as Munro bends his knee and marmalises it over mid-off for a six
Abbott seeks a yorker, fires it too full on middle and leg, squeezed away behind square on the leg side
shortish and outside off, mis-hit in front of long-off

AB de Villiers comes into the action, makes a tough catch look pretty easy. Banged in short and attacking the body of Munro, who was crouching low. He looks to pull and drags it over long-on. AB turns, runs back, gets into a side-on position and pulls it off calmly

140.9ks, castled. Rabada is on a hat-trick for the second game in a row. Neesham shuffles way outside off as he aims for a lap-scoop, with fine leg in the circle. He can't connect, Rabada fires it full and straight. Timber!
good length and angled, solidly blocked back to the bowler
shortish and down leg, helped down to long leg, only one
bouncer, flies through to the keeper. The batsman leaps off his feet but can't ramp it away
full and on middle, steps away outside leg and french-cuts it fine on the leg side
low full toss on middle, whipped with the wrists over backward square
N Mac backs away, he looks to whack it to leg but does not connect well. Dribbles it behind to the keeper. It was not far away from the off stump either
Milne backs away again, pitched full and wide outside off. He can't reach out and hit it
pitched up and on off, scythed away to sweeper for two. Rabada runs to his right and does well
Abbott messes up. He dishes out a full toss on middle, which is lofted over mid-on, who is inside the circle
